Vladimir Ritz Bossicard wrote:


> And (yet) another alternative:
> 
>  projects
>      build.xml
>      +- src
>            +- java
>            +- config
>      +- test
>            +- java
>            +- config
>            +- data
>      +- build
>            +- classes
>            +- classes-test
>            +- javadoc
>            +- reports
> 
> The goal is to separate the source files from the produced files:


I'd go one step further if you're using code generation tasks and 
break them out from the main code tree, while not putting them under 
  build. Personally speaking, I tried the JDA layout for a while and 
didn't like it. Fwiw, I'm leaning towards this layout:

      build.xml
      + src
            +- java
                  +- org...
            +- test
                  +- org...
            +- gen
                  +- org...
            +- webapps
            +- xslt
            +- ...
      +- build
            +- classes
            +- lib
            +- javadoc
      +- conf
      +- docs
      +- ...

Bill de h�ra
